title: Child Custody Rights During Divorce
description: Understanding your rights regarding child custody, visitation, and maintenance during divorce proceedings under Indian family law.

rights.title: Natural Guardian Rights
rights.description: Both parents have equal rights as natural guardians of their children under Indian law.
rights.application: Father is natural guardian of children above 5 years, mother for children below 5 years. Court can modify based on child's welfare.
limitations: Other personal laws may have different provisions

rights.title: Best Interest of Child Principle
rights.description: Courts prioritize child's welfare over parental rights in custody decisions.
rights.application: Court considers child's emotional, physical, educational needs and stability when awarding custody.

actionSteps.title: Understand Different Types of Custody
actionSteps.description: Learn about physical custody, legal custody, joint custody, and visitation rights available under law.

actionSteps.title: Gather Evidence of Parenting Capability
actionSteps.description: Document your involvement in child's daily life, education, healthcare, and emotional support.

actionSteps.title: Attempt Mediation
actionSteps.description: Try to reach an amicable custody arrangement through family counseling or mediation before court.

actionSteps.title: File Custody Petition in Family Court
actionSteps.description: If mediation fails, file formal petition for child custody with supporting documents.
